embeds.title: Recklessness
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_slime: / The Slime Boss / Downfall

Your "Tackle" cards deal 6 (9) more damage to enemies, and 1 more damage to you.

messages.content:
on the one hand:
that is a LARGE damage boost
on the other hand:
slime boss has one multihit that doesn't even get boosted by this, and tackles are not great
If I'm going sufficiently all in n one strategy such that I'll take a power which only boosts those cards, that strategy is not gonna be tackles

I've talked about this card a lot already, so theres not much more new to say. Recklessness is one of the best slime boss powers, +6 to all of your spear tackles is easily worth its cost and it upgrades to an even better +9. Recklessness is a reason you would want to take additional tackle cards like combo tackle and hungry tackle as well.  Its a very efficient way to improve a lot of the best attacks in your deck. The downside of taking 1 more damage is extremely minor; non existent if you play roll through.

I think what some people get wrong about tackles is that they think that you are supposed to play a "tackles only deck" don't do that, you will have no block and die. Tackles are just really good attacks that you can take to rip early game apart and still have value later on in the run. Recklessness plays a big part in adding late game value to these cards. 20+ damage for 1 is good damage even by act 4 standards.

This is a bizarre power. I can't deny that 6 (9) is a massive increase in damage for 1 energy, that's three times the effectiveness of inflame from ironclad. On the other hand, it only applies to tackles, which have an extremely limited support package (1 shop relic to remove the self damage, roll through to remove self damage, flame tackle and this to increase damage, and playbook at rare to generate more tackles). Now spear tackle is an incredibly good source of card draw, and you would often want to have 3+ copies in your deck if you could find them, and if you find the event that lets you replace strikes with the basic tackles, that is also a strong way to increase the number of tackles in your deck. Otherwise, I can't see many slime boss decks playing more than 2 or 3 of them (including the basic one you start with), as goop also does a great job of frontloading damage, and is far better supported to scale into the late game. 

There really isn't a tackle deck, you just sometimes take 1 or 2 early game to help with frontloading, and of course spear tackle is great. I don't think recklessness is worth including unless you have at least 4 tackles in the deck, and even then it's a very limited source of damage scaling. You give up a card draw and pay 1 energy for this and it doesn't do anything until you find a tackle. It's only done 6 damage for 1 energy after the first, and only 12 damage for 1 energy after you play the second. If you draw this in the bottom half after already going past most of your tackles, it really suffers. There is always some risk with powers of drawing poorly because they need the right support and don't typically frontload, but the reward here just doesn't seem worth it most of the time unless you have lots of tackles, and that's usually not a place you want to be. I haven't discussed the extra 1 damage you take back, it's not that big of a deal considering how good slime boss is at healing, but it's not a great look either.
lol
making it even more silly if tackles were viable
but they’re not really in act3 and arguably even act2 elites, tackles focused strat will struggle trying to burst down before taking lots of damage if rng is poor
unless tackles are not a large portion of the deck but then why do you take this
I sometimes feel like we are not playing the same character tbh

This just feels like a bait card to me. You look at it and see "oh wow that's some high numbers" but it rarely works out. Tackles are at their best in act 1 or early act 2, where powers are at their worst.
this is probably a Fundamental Playstyle Difference thing again
And as for acs 4, yeah that damage can help, but that's not going to win act 3 for you, little over act 4.
14 damage opening tackle is gross, that card is already pretty decent. Flame tackle is the only buff theres thats acutally needed, that card sorta sucks
tbh it can be worth taking even if all you have is 3 spear tackles; slime boss can thin its deck down small enough to the point where you are playing a spear tackle every turn.
spear tackle being so character defining plays a big part as to why I think recklessness is really good, I probably should of highlighted that card earlier.
